alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Park County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued May 21 at 2:43AM MDT until May 21 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: .Snow will continue to slowly decrease from north to south across the region this morning. Light snow will linger across the Front Range urban corridor with bands of moderate to heavy snow showers primarily over the Palmer Divide. Snow accumulation on trees this morning will cause some tree limbs to break and produce scattered power outages. Do not park under trees and avoid walking under snow laden trees. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 4 inches. * WHERE...South Park. * WHEN...Until Noon MDT today. * IMPACTS...Snow accumulated on tree branches and powerlines, may break and lead to power outages. Roads will be slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Do not touch downed lines and report any power outages to your electric company. Travel is highly discouraged due to slick roadways and the possibility of downed trees and power lines.
